events.description: ​ sundays is back ☀️ 🚗 ucla → usc: rideshare coordination sheet her e ​ ​​ what to expect: we’ll kick things off with intros, then dive into pomodoro-based co-working sprints to lock in on your projects. bring whatever you’re building: startup, side project, design and give yourself a solid block of time to actually make progress. ​ ​​afterwards, we’ll circle up for a show-and-tell where everyone shares what they worked on, what they learned, and what they’re building toward. ​ ​​ schedule: 2:00 – 2:15 pm → introductions + icebreakers 2:15 – 5:15 pm → pomodoro deep work 5:15 – 6:00 pm → show & tell + community hang ​ ​​ bring snacks! not required, but highly encouraged to fight off the sunday scaries + keep the energy high :) ​ ​​ who’s it for? this is a space for every field, every passion. makers, artists, researchers, and founders, and more! anyone actively building something outside of class and looking for a space to focus, share progress, and connect with peers who get it. ​ ​​sundays is la’s lowkey ode to socratica, but west coast style. founders is the new home for trojan student founders. together we’re carving out space to build, share, and grow as a community. ​ ​​see you on sunday ✌️🐻

events.title: From Roadmaps to Agents: How AI Is Reshaping Product Management and Innovation Opportunities for Startups to Big Tech
events.location: Center for Tech ManagementUCLA Anderson School of Management
events.description: ​ 4 p.m. - 5 p.m. .......  Networking Reception (Grand Salon) ​ 5 p.m. - 6 p.m. .................. Speaker Event (Executive Dining Room) ​ ​ About Joff Redfern - Partner, Menlo Ventures ​ A self-described “tall, slightly nerdy product guy,” Joff was previously the Chief Product Officer of Atlassian, responsible for leading its acclaimed portfolio of products, including Jira, Confluence, and Trello. During that time, Joff was named on the “Global CPO 20” list by Products That Count and as a “Top 20 Product Leader” by Product School. Prior to joining Atlassian, he spent seven years at LinkedIn, where he built the mobile team and led the consumer product as the company grew from 450 employees pre-IPO to 10,000+. His deep experience as an advisor, founder, product leader, and operator has given him a broad perspective and skill set that make him uniquely equipped to work with early-stage teams as an investor and an advisor. As a partner at Menlo, Joff is passionate about: 1) the software development lifecycle; 2) the big shift in the future of work due to AI, especially next-generation business and productivity apps; and 3) businesses with network effects, networks, and marketplaces. He is drawn to founders who can combine engineering chops with great product sensibilities—rare individuals whom he considers to be the next wave of great entrepreneurs. Joff’s life philosophy is “Less is more.” He is always in search of a better way and holds 11 patents. No stranger to entrepreneurship, he co-founded FlattenMe—award-winning, personalized children’s products that were selected as a top gift by Oprah, Good Morning America, the Today Show, the View, and more. He loves the company journey and knows what it takes to hyperscale an organization and product portfolio, moving from zero customers to IPO and beyond. Joff earned his BA from Bates College and received his MBA from Cornell Johnson Graduate School of Management. Outside of work, Joff is an avid adventurer—he believes life is to be lived, used up, and thoroughly enjoyed. He lives on an organic farm with his family, where they raise llamas and chickens and are food-, water-, and energy-independent. He has hiked the 220-mile John Muir Trail and sailed across the Atlantic Ocean.

events.title: Space Beach Industry Reception with Artist Richelle Ellis
events.description: ​ Cocktails, connection, and a featured artist talk with Richelle Ellis —expeditionary artist, curator, and analog astronaut—inside the Future Fest Pop-Up at 236 Pine Ave, Downtown Long Beach . ​ Built for the space industry: meet founders, operators, investors, engineers, counsel, and partners, explore space-inspired works on view, and hear Richelle on creativity, exploration, and the human story of Space 3.0. ​ Richelle Ellis is an expeditionary artist and analog astronaut exploring life across interconnected systems—from organisms and social structures to ecosystems and planetary networks—revealing the complexity and interdependence that bind them. She creates artworks designed for extreme and off-world environments, including works placed in international orbit, etched onto satellites, suspended by stratospheric balloons, and launched aboard rockets. ​ Ellis serves as Head of Creative Research for analog space missions with Hawaii Space Exploration Analog and Simulation (HI-SEAS), the Sensoria Program, Astroland Planetary Agency, and the Lunares Research Station, where she examines creativity beyond Earth-bound conditions. Her artistic and research expeditions span from glaciers near the Arctic Circle to a Space2Sea voyage in Antarctica, from parabolic Zero-G flights to immersive work within Biosphere 2 and NASA-affiliated analog Mars missions. ​ She has received accolades and residencies from institutions including Planet, Google Quantum AI, Karman Project, Relativity, and SETI Institute. Her work has been exhibited internationally at the Museum of Contemporary Art Tokyo, the Venice Biennale's newly founded Universe Pavillion, and the Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum, with recent artworks placed on the surface of the Moon. Her next creative project is slated for early 2026, becoming the first artwork ever adhered to an asteroid. ​ She is also the co-founder of Inploration, a nonprofit art and space initiative dedicated to deepening public appreciation for our planet by fostering new perspectives through art, science, and exploration. ​ Capacity is limited. RSVP required.

events.title: Demo Day LA - Feb 2026
events.description: ​ Presented by Nerdstage ​ LA's largest tech startup community with over 50k community members. ​ If you're a builder turning hard problems into progress, you might be a fit for the Nerdstage Pitch Accelerator . ​ LA’s most anticipated startup demo event, bringing together a room full of investors eager to back what’s next. ​ The night features multiple founder pitch sessions, live demos, and a fireside chat with industry leaders sharing real, unfiltered insight. Expect strong ideas, serious conversations, and networking that actually goes somewhere. ​ Come ready to connect. Come ready to be inspired. Come hungry. There will be tacos. 🌮 ​ ​Demo Day LA Investor Panels have included: ​ ​Stay tuned for more updates on event details and speakers. We can’t wait to see you at demodayLA 2026! ​ ​ 🚀 Startup Founders: ​ Secure a Startup Demo registration (limited availability) and unlock a high-impact experience. ​ What you get: ​ • A dedicated demo table to showcase your product to a room full of technologists, investors, and key connectors. ​ • A one-on-one pitch maximization session with veteran pitch coach Kirin Kalia (a $1,000 value). ​ • Direct, actionable feedback to sharpen your story, strengthen your deck, and level up your delivery. ​ • The opportunity to pitch live on stage in front of the Demo Day LA audience and investor panel. ​ This is a proven combination of actionable coaching, on-stage amplification, instant feedback, and powerful connections. ​ [Apply Here] ​ ​ ​​Highlights from previous special guests ​ Mike Jones , General Partner at Science Inc ., where he co-founded the venture fund and startup studio in 2011. He’s helped build and invest in companies like Liquid Death, PlayVS, and Pray.com, with portfolio exits totaling $3.7B including Dollar Shave Club, FameBit, and HelloSociety. ​ Josh Resnick , Co-Founder and General Partner at OpenSky Ventures , an early-stage VC firm in Los Angeles, and manages his family office, Pure Imagination Brands, with a personal portfolio of 50+ companies. He previously co-founded Pandemic Studios, acquired by Electronic Arts for $860M, and later founded Sugarfina. His work has been recognized by Fast Company and Goldman Sachs. ​ ​ Join Nerds of LA ​ Join Nerds of LA ! We’re building the ultimate network by connecting with other powerhouse groups in the area, expanding our reach across the city. If you’re ready to link up with founders, VCs, AI visionaries, and innovators shaping the future, this is the group you’ve been looking for.  🤝 🦾 ​ NOTE : All purchases are final and non-refundable . Please double-check your order before completing your transaction, as we are unable to offer refunds once the purchase has been made. ​ Media Release Notice By attending this event, I hereby give my free and unlimited consent and permission to Nerdstage, its affiliates, and the event photographer to capture and use photographs, video, or audio of me during the event. I understand these may be published or shared—without limitation—for promotional, marketing, or editorial purposes, with or without identification by name. I waive any right to compensation or claims arising from such use.

events.title: Beyond the Game: The Business of Ownership @AllStar Weekend
events.description: ​ ProEdge Branding & Wefranch are hosting a Pitch Event where professional athletes, emerging brands, and franchise leaders come together to pitch, negotiate, network, and finalize real business collaborations live on stage with a corporation like Chick-fil-A Restaurants . ​An invite-only experience showcases in real time how elite athletes and executives leverage visibility, brand equity, and innovation to build ownership, partnerships, and equity opportunities beyond the game. This event convenes top decision-makers from sports, business, consulting, tech, venture capital, and franchising. For an evening of live deal-making, education, and high-value networking. The environment is designed to show in real time how athletes and executives leverage identity, visibility, and strategic partnerships to build ownership across brands, franchises, real estate, and IP. ​From influence to ownership, the event goes beyond traditional athlete summits. Demonstrating that the most powerful path to generational wealth is through ownership of brands, franchises, real estate, and intellectual property. This event will present the blueprint for modern wealth creation and brand ownership, connecting athlete influence with scalable business opportunities behind the scenes ​📆Thursday, Feb 12th, 6-8 PM (during NBA All-Star Weekend 2026) ​ Franchises: ​ 🐔 Chick-fil-A : legendary chicken sandwich chain. ​🎹 Oatmeal Radio Cafe : an emerging coffeeshop music studio founded by NBA star Baron Davis ​ 🧋 Bambu : the first Vietnamese drink franchise expanding at 2200+ Walmart's. ​ 🧑‍🧑‍🧒 Primrose : best-in-class early childcare with 500+ units. ​ ⛳️ Planet Fitness : A gym & fitness club for everybody with thousands of locations worldwide. ​ Brands: ​ Arena : a networking platform for professionals in sports, media & entertainment. ​ Kravings :premier cannabis delivery service catering to the amazing clientele. ​ COI Energy : Making the world more energy efficient. ​ AthletIQ : Learn. Improve. Compete. Basketball. ​ Ms. P's Gluten Free : Granola That Feels Like Home. ​ ProsperityAI : helps high-performing individuals and professionals take control of their financial lives. ​ Itinerary: ​ 6 PM: Keynote Speakers ​ 6:15 PM: The Deal Floor A curated set of athlete and franchise pitches followed by live responses from investors, operators, brand executives, and the audience. ​ 7 PM: The Deal Lounge Athletes, agents, investors, and founders connect further over drinks and snacks. ​🥂🍰Drinks & bites by Chef Morgan Mead included ​Hosted by ProEdge Branding ( The premier athlete legacy & brand-building platform bridging sports, business, and culture) . events.title: Hoops & Icons - 2026
events.description: ​ It’s 2026 and Hoops & Icons is back!🏀🔥 ​ Presented by The Players Company in partnership with the legendary Drew League. ​ Join us on February 12th starting @ 6pm at Hollywood Park in Inglewood, California to experience the All-Star energy without the All-Star price tag. This incredibly exciting annual event during NBA All-Star Weekend in LA, will be completely free as always, and better than ever featuring a special guest appearance from NBA Champion & Hall of Famer Paul Pierce. ​ Come watch top names in basketball, entertainment, and social media compete in our signature events, as you eat, drink, enjoy and cheer on your favorites. This is the one night where the entire community gets VIP access! ​ ​ What You’ll Experience ​ Doors open @ 6pm sharp and we’ll be going strong until 9pm with can’t miss entertainment! ​ 🏀 5x5 Celebrity Game — Influencers, athletes, and celebrities battle it out with Paul Pierce as a special guest coach ​ 🎯 3-Point Shootout — Elite shooters competing for bragging rights ​ 🔥 Dunk Contest — World-class dunkers delivering jaw-dropping performances ​ 🎪 Festival Atmosphere — Food trucks, drinks, local vendors, and hundreds of fans ​ 🏆 Presented with The Drew League — LA’s most iconic, pro-am league elevating the competition and the game ​ ​ Why Hoops & Icons? ​ Official All-Star events can cost $300–$1,500+ and many VIP experiences are locked behind paywalls. Hoops & Icons changes that, giving families and fans a high-energy, unforgettable All-Star night without spending a dime. ​ Past guests have included Keith Lee, Hannah White, and Terrell Owens and this year is bigger than ever! ​ ​ The Players Company ​ The Players Company is an athlete-founded organization committed to helping athletes and investors achieve their full financial potential. We provide the tools, resources, education and opportunities needed to grow, manage and sustain generational wealth. We are a collective of athletes and investors aimed at empowering our community through financial education, sports and venture-focused media events, and access to exclusive investment opportunities.

events.title: MY SONIC VALENTINE: Love Wrapped in Sound
events.description: ​ A FREE immersive Valentine’s Day offering. ​ Step into a Valentine’s Day experience unlike any other, where love, sound, art, and vibration invite connection, presence, play, and yes, more love. ​ Presented by Sonic Unity , My Sonic Valentine: Love Wrapped in Sound marks their West Coast debut, with a gathering that reimagines Valentine’s Day beyond romance, embracing self-love, friendship, and community through sound and art, and unfolds its vision across the indoor and outdoor spaces of The Wende Museum. ​ Doors open at 3:30pm and Guests will be invited to move freely, follow the sound, and experience living art and soundscapes that unfold across the museum’s spaces. This is envisioned as an interactive sound-art journey, an experience that blends stillness with mindful movement into the realm of dreamlike wandering gently through sound, art and connection. ​ In the spirit of community and public art, we are honored to welcome the NXT Art Foundation , which will present their brilliant Attune 1.0 , a first-of-its-kind public art platform designed to connect Angelenos through coordinated sound and light-based works presented simultaneously across multiple locations. Attune 1.0 , presented by NXT Art Foundation and Arup and produced by Carmen Zella (Cofounder, NXT Art Foundation and Creative Director, NOW Art), will unfold across Los Angeles County at sunset on Valentine’s Day as part of a free, family-friendly public art experience. ​ Attune 1.0 will activate the garden space as a central feature, inviting guests to bring picnic blankets or chairs and settle around a light-based installation as they experience a collective sound journey created by local artists to inspire connection and calm… ​ …and AMPLIFY LOVE . ​ At the heart of the experience is a continuous sound bath flow in the museum theater, where guests are invited to receive as much or as little sound as feels right—dipping in and out as they wish. You are welcome to lie down, sit, move quietly, or simply listen as sound moves through the space. We ask that this space be held with care and mindfulness, honoring it as a sacred environment for sound bathing. ​ THEATER | THE SOUND BATH SANCTUARY ​ A curated progression of exceptional sound artists bathing you with healing sound ​ 4:00 PM – Isaac Sabu Vibroacoustic frequencies and immersive sound healing ​ 5:00 PM – Anthony Profeta 2025 Evergreen Award Winner for Best Sound Therapist in the USA , often referred to as “The Mozart of Sound” ​ 6:00 PM – Sandy Duarte Stage 4 Cancer Survivor whose sound was born in chemo. A deeply intentional sound journey rooted in lived healing experience Supported by Peter Hess® Therapy Bowls and Rainbow Sounds® crystal bowls ​ 6:40 PM – Closing Sound Bath A powerful collective sound immersion where all artists come together to close ​ Joining us as a special guest is Grammy-nominated artist Bella Rabbit , adding her presence and creative spirit to the gathering. ​ Bella Rabbit is a Grammy-nominated songwriter, artist and producer whose voice moves between sensitivity & power, using sound as a frequency to alchemize emotion and presence. Her vocal work bridges intimacy and expansiveness, inviting listeners into a shared space of resonance and release. ​ ​ SPACES BEYOND ​ Discover Biotune Wellness Technology through vibroacoustic offerings available on a first-come, first-served basis. These experiences invite deep relaxation, heart–brain coherence, and elevated states of meditation, supporting both individual and collective wellness. ​ Fresh organic cold pressed juices to amplify your health and harmony from Eli's Elixers in the garden bar. ​ Plus, make your way up to the museum’s beautiful rooftop for Sonic Unity Talking Circles —a welcoming space for reflection, heartfelt conversation, and meaningful connection, hosted by Janein Chavez and Nick Sharp. ​ 4pm - 5:30pm ​ Janein Chavez, LMFT is a Native Angeleno, licensed psychotherapist, grief specialist, artist, globe trotter, star gazer, and radical self-care advocate. She spreads a message of self love and self compassion to her chicana/latina sisters, BIPOC women, and all people everywhere. Janein regards her life’s work as a healing artist and keeper of sacred secrets and memories, who explores and navigates the complex terrain of the heart, mind, body, spirit and soul, as if exploring any terrain on the planet…with love, admiration, respect, curiosity, reverence and awe. ​ 5:30pm - 6:30pm ​ Nick Sharp, M.A., LPCC, GEP is a nature-based therapist and guide who works with humans navigating change, transition, and personal development through relationships. His work integrates adventure therapy, equine-assisted experiences, men’s group facilitation, and off-grid sailing expeditions—across the country and internationally—to support regulation, accountability, and embodied presence. Grounded in service and lived experience, he creates structured environments where meaningful change occurs through direct engagement with inner wildness and living wilderness. ​ WHAT THIS IS ​ This is not a workshop or a traditional performance. It is a curated sonic environment designed for listening, nervous system regulation, reflection, shared presence, and most of all LOVE . ​ Open to all—come alone, with a partner, or with friends and family. Experience Valentine’s Day as a moment of self-love, friendship, community, and collective resonance. ​ ​ ABOUT SONIC UNITY ​ Sonic Unity is a collective devoted to exploring sound as a universal language for healing, connection, and collective resonance—where love is the language beyond words. Their work brings together ancient and contemporary vibrational expressions through sound, art, and technology to create immersive experiences that support nervous system regulation, emotional clarity, embodied presence, and community gathering. ​ Sonic Unity was co-founded by wellness & creative artist Sandy Duarte and wellness entrepreneur Melissa Rosen with the mission to foster coherence within the self, between individuals, and across communities through intentional sound and vibratory experiences. ​ Sandy’s sound practice was born during her journey through chemotherapy as a Stage 4 cancer patient, where sound became a source of calm, grounding, and inner peace. That lived experience informs the depth, care, and intention behind every Sonic Unity offering. ​ This Valentine’s Day gathering marks the West Coast debut of Sonic Unity’s immersive sound work , following an acclaimed multi-day event during Miami Art Week featuring over 25 sound facilitators of various genres in collaboration for continuous sound programming. ​ As founders of this movement, we leave you with both our ethos to ponder with joy and possibility. ​ “The power of love’s sound is for everyone.” – Sandy Duarte “Listening is love.” – Melissa Rosen

events.title: Slab & Spread — A Galentine's Gathering
events.description: ​ Remember the days of gathering with your girlfriends—catching up on life, surrounded by boundless laughter, easy snacking, and that unmistakable glow of all-around feminine energy? If you’re craving that kind of connection, join us for our very first Galentine’s Party with Cera Sera Studio x Femme Feast . ​ On Saturday, February 14th from 6–9PM , we’ll come together for a welcoming, creative evening rooted in trusting the process—in clay, in friendship, and in the simple joy of making something by hand. We’ll gather around the table to slow down, snack generously, and craft slab-built ceramic snack and serving trays designed to hold future spreads, sweet moments, and shared meals. ​ You’ll be guided through a slab-building lesson where you’ll shape, texture, and personalize your own ceramic tray. No experience needed—this workshop is all about play, imperfection, and letting things unfold naturally (because clay, like life, often gets a little messy before it gets good). ​ Throughout the evening, enjoy a thoughtfully curated communal snacking spread meant to be nibbled on as we create, connect, and celebrate the magic of gathering—whether you come solo, with a friend, or roll deep with your favorite gals. ​ ✨ Come for the clay. Stay for the snacks, the laughter, and the reminder that good things take time. Dress for a night out with the girls—styled up, dressed down, or somewhere in between. Wear whatever makes you feel most like you . ​ Your piece will be fired and glazed after the workshop and ready for pick-up in 6–8 weeks . ​ What’s Included 💝 • Guided ceramic handbuilding instruction by Cera Sera Studio (beginner-friendly, thoughtfully paced) • All clay, tools, glazing, and kiln firing — handled from start to finish 🎨 • A slab-built ceramic snack or serving tray, handmade by you • Generous grazing spread by Femme Feast 🧀 • Cheeky sips by Mas Vino Please 🥂 • Desserts by Sam Robinson Pastry 🧁 • An exclusive attendee-only raffle featuring thoughtfully curated goodies to pamper yourself long after the party ends ✨ ​ A thoughtfully curated, candlelit evening designed to romanticize the moment — celebrating friendship, self-love, and a really good vibe. Peek the inspiration vibes here ! ​ 📍 Location: Say When — 1859 W. Adams Blvd, West Adams ​ 👩🏽‍🎨 Limited spots available — reserve yours today! ​ ​​​​​ Can't make it? Join our next workshop .

events.description: ​ We’re teaming up with Boichik Bagels for a relaxed morning of bagels, matcha, and pups. Bring your dog, your dog-loving friends, and come together with the community for a morning of good vibes, tasty bites, and wagging tails. ​ What to expect: 🥯 Complimentary pup cups and bagels on us — toppings available for purchase 🛍️ Something Good Treats for the pups (while supplies last!) 🌱 Fresh Patch potty station and Peony Celeste eco-poop bags 🧢 DOSC merch portion of proceeds benefiting Baldwin Park Animal Care Center ​ Come hungry, bring your dog and friends, and stay awhile to connect with fellow dog lovers. 💛 ​ 📆 Find more events at www.dogsonlysocialclub.com or @dogsonlysocialclub and subscribe to join our mailing list ! ​ ​ About Dogs Only Social Club (DOSC): DOSC is a free community group that brings pet lovers together across Los Angeles. We create un-fur-gettable experiences and meaningful connections, uniting pet parents through tail-wagging events and charitable initiatives. events.title: Clay & Matcha: A Valentine’s Workshop
events.description: ​ Join Cera Sera Studio and Toastique for a Valentine’s Day–inspired morning of clay, connection, and brunch at Toastique 💕 ​ This special edition workshop is all about celebrating creativity and slowing down together—because Valentine’s Day isn’t just about romance, it’s about love in all its forms. ​ 🗓 Sunday, February 15th ⏰ 10AM – 1PM 📍 Toastique | Hollywood ​ Settle in for a hands-on ceramic handbuilding workshop where you’ll learn foundational techniques—pinching, coiling, and shaping—to create your own one-of-a-kind piece. Check some inspiration here! Come with your love interest, partner, friend, your whole group chat, or solo and ready to mingle. No experience needed—just a willingness to play, connect, and get your hands in the clay. ​ As you create, enjoy a complimentary matcha or coffee , or add on a nourishing brunch from Toastique’s vibrant, specialty menu (see below)—thoughtfully crafted to fuel both body and creativity. ​ Toast options: ​ Avocado smash Smoked Salmon Greek ​ Bowl options: ​ PB&B Acai Bowl Dragon Berry ​ 🎟️ Ticket Includes: ​ Guided ceramic handbuilding workshop with Cera Sera Studio ​ All clay, tools, and materials ​ Firing and glazing of your finished piece ​ Your choice of (1) matcha or coffee ​ ✨ All ticket prices include tax and gratuity for Toastique’s staff. ​ 🌿 No experience needed—just good vibes and an open heart 👩🏽‍🎨 Limited spots available 💖 Perfect for celebrating Valentine’s Day with your favorite people (or yourself!)

events.description: ​ Join AHN and Cooley for our Lunar New Year Celebration, a networking event uniting founders, investors, and aspiring entrepreneurs in Los Angeles to ring in the Year of the Horse. 🐎 ​ ​This event serves to celebrate the new year and provide an opportunity for founders and investors to learn about market trends, building startups, and raising money at the pre-seed and seed fundraising stages. ​ ​ *Due to limited event capacity, we are prioritizing registrations to founders, investors, and local partners. Please RSVP early to secure your entry. ​ ​📍 Location: Santa Monica, CA (exact location to be shared after registration) 🗓️ Date: Thursday, February 19, 2026 🕔 Time: 6:00–8:00 PM (PST) ​ ​ ⏰ Event Schedule 6:00–6:30: Food, drinks, and networking 6:30–7:30: Fireside chat 7:30–8:00: Food, drinks, and networking ​ ​ 🚗 Parking You can park in the office building's lot. Parking validation will be provided at the event. 🤝 Sponsored by Chingoo Snacks , Narra , Birdie , and Brandon’s Ice Cream ​ ​See you there! 🎉​ ​ Meet the Hosts ​ ​ Asian Hustle Network (AHN) ​ ​AHN is the largest global community of Asian entrepreneurs, investors, operators, and leaders, with a mission to be the global superconnector of all Asians around the world. ​ ​ Cooley LLP ​ ​Clients partner with Cooley on transformative deals, complex IP and regulatory matters, and high-stakes litigation, where innovation meets the law.  Cooley has more than 1,300 lawyers across 19 offices in the United States, Asia and Europe, and a total workforce of nearly 3,000. ​ ​Meet the Speakers ​ Stephan Peng is the Founder and CEO of Redbloom Health , the biotech company creating food medicine for chronic conditions. He created the only HSA/FSA-approved food clinically supporting IBS, GERD, dyspepsia, and colitis. Previously, Steph led product at Cheetah, Y Combinator’s largest food-tech success story, which later exited to private equity. A UC Berkeley alum and Forbes 30 Under 30 honoree, Steph now builds at the intersection of biotech, food medicine, and consumer health. ​ Jonathan Hung is a venture capitalist, operator, and entrepreneur who partners closely with founders to help turn ambitious ideas into real, scalable businesses. He is the Managing Partner of Entrepreneur Ventures , a fund co-founded with Entrepreneur Media, and also runs his family office, J Heart Ventures, with investments in 250+ companies and 50+ funds. Before investing, Jonathan led his family’s textile business across the U.S. and Asia, giving him hands-on operating experience in building teams, managing growth, and navigating cross-border challenges. He also serves as an Adjunct Professor, mentoring the next generation of builders, and holds degrees from Wharton, MIT, LSE, and USC. ​ Eric Wei is cofounder of @trykarat aka Karat Financial . Karat helps creators manage their finances and has raised over $100M, including from cofounders of Twitter, Twitch, and YouTube. Before Karat, Eric built products for creators at Instagram, did fintech at McKinsey, and investment banking at Blackstone. He studied economics at Harvard.

events.title: Art Show Closing: The Balance of Elements by Liana Grigoryan
events.description: ​ ​RiTA HOUSE PRESENTS: The Balance of Elements by Liana Grigoryan Thursday, February 19th from 6:30 - 9 PM ​ Join us at Rita House for a deeply personal series centered around the Five Elements: Earth, Water, Fire, Air, and Spirit. ​ Inspired by a desire to reconnect with nature's wisdom, Liana Grigoryan's work is a visual meditation on what it means to find balance within ourselves and with the world around us. This series explores how the elements reflect the cycles we all experience: creation, destruction, movement, stillness, and transcendence. ​ We invite you to experience this powerful celebration of life and connection. Light bites will be served, and drinks will be available for purchase. ​ ​ FEATURED ARTIST Liana Grigoryan ​ Liana Grigoryan is an award-winning fashion and fine art photographer based in Los Angeles. Liana’s photography captures the essence of the ever-changing world of fashion through bright colors and unexpected designs. Her work has been featured in Vogue, ELLE USA, Cosmopolitan, L’Officiel, Institute, Beverly Hills Living, Schön, and more magazines. Check out her portfolio here: https://lianagrigoryan.com/ ​ ​Rita House is a dynamic, multi-use space where people of all generations come to work, create, film, and host events including art exhibitions, immersive theatre, panels and screenings. Centrally located in a stunning 1926 Spanish Colonial building by The Grove minutes away from West Hollywood, Rita House bridges centuries of creative history with modern innovation. Originally built in 1929 as a Prop Design Studio for film and television, the building later became a violin factory producing instruments for schools nationwide. In 1967, it was purchased by award-winning costume designer Rita Riggs, who worked with legends like Alfred Hitchcock and Norman Lear. Rita established her design studio here and pioneered a unique model of creative coworking, cultivating a community of design professionals who shared her commitment to excellence and collaboration. ​ ​Today, architects and founders Tash Rahbar and Scott Strumwasser continue Rita’s legacy. After operating their architectural practice in the space for over three decades, they lovingly restored the nearly 100-year-old building and transformed it into the sanctuary for creative exploration it is today—carrying forward Rita’s spirit of innovation and community. In 2024, Rita House expanded its creative capabilities with a full-service production center, including professional content creation facilities and a podcasting studio developed in partnership with Operation Podcast.

sundays in la: feb 8
ca--los-angeles.description: ​ sundays is back ☀️ 🚗 ucla → usc: rideshare coordination sheet her e ​ ​​ what to expect: we’ll kick things off with intros, then dive into pomodoro-based co-working sprints to lock in on your projects. bring whatever you’re building: startup, side project, design and give yourself a solid block of time to actually make progress. ​ ​​afterwards, we’ll circle up for a show-and-tell where everyone shares what they worked on, what they learned, and what they’re building toward. ​ ​​ schedule: 2:00 – 2:15 pm → introductions + icebreakers 2:15 – 5:15 pm → pomodoro deep work 5:15 – 6:00 pm → show & tell + community hang ​ ​​ bring snacks! not required, but highly encouraged to fight off the sunday scaries + keep the energy high :) ​ ​​ who’s it for? this is a space for every field, every passion. makers, artists, researchers, and founders, and more! anyone actively building something outside of class and looking for a space to focus, share progress, and connect with peers who get it. ​ ​​sundays is la’s lowkey ode to socratica, but west coast style. founders is the new home for trojan student founders. together we’re carving out space to build, share, and grow as a community. ​ ​​see you on sunday ✌️🐻

ca--los-angeles.title: From Roadmaps to Agents: How AI Is Reshaping Product Management and Innovation Opportunities for Startups to Big Tech
ca--los-angeles.location: Center for Tech ManagementUCLA Anderson School of Management
ca--los-angeles.description: ​ 4 p.m. - 5 p.m. .......  Networking Reception (Grand Salon) ​ 5 p.m. - 6 p.m. .................. Speaker Event (Executive Dining Room) ​ ​ About Joff Redfern - Partner, Menlo Ventures ​ A self-described “tall, slightly nerdy product guy,” Joff was previously the Chief Product Officer of Atlassian, responsible for leading its acclaimed portfolio of products, including Jira, Confluence, and Trello. During that time, Joff was named on the “Global CPO 20” list by Products That Count and as a “Top 20 Product Leader” by Product School. Prior to joining Atlassian, he spent seven years at LinkedIn, where he built the mobile team and led the consumer product as the company grew from 450 employees pre-IPO to 10,000+. His deep experience as an advisor, founder, product leader, and operator has given him a broad perspective and skill set that make him uniquely equipped to work with early-stage teams as an investor and an advisor. As a partner at Menlo, Joff is passionate about: 1) the software development lifecycle; 2) the big shift in the future of work due to AI, especially next-generation business and productivity apps; and 3) businesses with network effects, networks, and marketplaces. He is drawn to founders who can combine engineering chops with great product sensibilities—rare individuals whom he considers to be the next wave of great entrepreneurs. Joff’s life philosophy is “Less is more.” He is always in search of a better way and holds 11 patents. No stranger to entrepreneurship, he co-founded FlattenMe—award-winning, personalized children’s products that were selected as a top gift by Oprah, Good Morning America, the Today Show, the View, and more. He loves the company journey and knows what it takes to hyperscale an organization and product portfolio, moving from zero customers to IPO and beyond. Joff earned his BA from Bates College and received his MBA from Cornell Johnson Graduate School of Management. Outside of work, Joff is an avid adventurer—he believes life is to be lived, used up, and thoroughly enjoyed. He lives on an organic farm with his family, where they raise llamas and chickens and are food-, water-, and energy-independent. He has hiked the 220-mile John Muir Trail and sailed across the Atlantic Ocean.

ca--los-angeles.title: Space Beach Industry Reception with Artist Richelle Ellis
ca--los-angeles.description: ​ Cocktails, connection, and a featured artist talk with Richelle Ellis —expeditionary artist, curator, and analog astronaut—inside the Future Fest Pop-Up at 236 Pine Ave, Downtown Long Beach . ​ Built for the space industry: meet founders, operators, investors, engineers, counsel, and partners, explore space-inspired works on view, and hear Richelle on creativity, exploration, and the human story of Space 3.0. ​ Richelle Ellis is an expeditionary artist and analog astronaut exploring life across interconnected systems—from organisms and social structures to ecosystems and planetary networks—revealing the complexity and interdependence that bind them. She creates artworks designed for extreme and off-world environments, including works placed in international orbit, etched onto satellites, suspended by stratospheric balloons, and launched aboard rockets. ​ Ellis serves as Head of Creative Research for analog space missions with Hawaii Space Exploration Analog and Simulation (HI-SEAS), the Sensoria Program, Astroland Planetary Agency, and the Lunares Research Station, where she examines creativity beyond Earth-bound conditions. Her artistic and research expeditions span from glaciers near the Arctic Circle to a Space2Sea voyage in Antarctica, from parabolic Zero-G flights to immersive work within Biosphere 2 and NASA-affiliated analog Mars missions. ​ She has received accolades and residencies from institutions including Planet, Google Quantum AI, Karman Project, Relativity, and SETI Institute. Her work has been exhibited internationally at the Museum of Contemporary Art Tokyo, the Venice Biennale's newly founded Universe Pavillion, and the Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum, with recent artworks placed on the surface of the Moon. Her next creative project is slated for early 2026, becoming the first artwork ever adhered to an asteroid. ​ She is also the co-founder of Inploration, a nonprofit art and space initiative dedicated to deepening public appreciation for our planet by fostering new perspectives through art, science, and exploration. ​ Capacity is limited. RSVP required.

ca--los-angeles.title: Demo Day LA - Feb 2026
ca--los-angeles.description: ​ Presented by Nerdstage ​ LA's largest tech startup community with over 50k community members. ​ If you're a builder turning hard problems into progress, you might be a fit for the Nerdstage Pitch Accelerator . ​ LA’s most anticipated startup demo event, bringing together a room full of investors eager to back what’s next. ​ The night features multiple founder pitch sessions, live demos, and a fireside chat with industry leaders sharing real, unfiltered insight. Expect strong ideas, serious conversations, and networking that actually goes somewhere. ​ Come ready to connect. Come ready to be inspired. Come hungry. There will be tacos. 🌮 ​ ​Demo Day LA Investor Panels have included: ​ ​Stay tuned for more updates on event details and speakers. We can’t wait to see you at demodayLA 2026! ​ ​ 🚀 Startup Founders: ​ Secure a Startup Demo registration (limited availability) and unlock a high-impact experience. ​ What you get: ​ • A dedicated demo table to showcase your product to a room full of technologists, investors, and key connectors. ​ • A one-on-one pitch maximization session with veteran pitch coach Kirin Kalia (a $1,000 value). ​ • Direct, actionable feedback to sharpen your story, strengthen your deck, and level up your delivery. ​ • The opportunity to pitch live on stage in front of the Demo Day LA audience and investor panel. ​ This is a proven combination of actionable coaching, on-stage amplification, instant feedback, and powerful connections. ​ [Apply Here] ​ ​ ​​Highlights from previous special guests ​ Mike Jones , General Partner at Science Inc ., where he co-founded the venture fund and startup studio in 2011. He’s helped build and invest in companies like Liquid Death, PlayVS, and Pray.com, with portfolio exits totaling $3.7B including Dollar Shave Club, FameBit, and HelloSociety. ​ Josh Resnick , Co-Founder and General Partner at OpenSky Ventures , an early-stage VC firm in Los Angeles, and manages his family office, Pure Imagination Brands, with a personal portfolio of 50+ companies. He previously co-founded Pandemic Studios, acquired by Electronic Arts for $860M, and later founded Sugarfina. His work has been recognized by Fast Company and Goldman Sachs. ​ ​ Join Nerds of LA ​ Join Nerds of LA ! We’re building the ultimate network by connecting with other powerhouse groups in the area, expanding our reach across the city. Hoops & Icons changes that, giving families and fans a high-energy, unforgettable All-Star night without spending a dime. ​ Past guests have included Keith Lee, Hannah White, and Terrell Owens and this year is bigger than ever! ​ ​ The Players Company ​ The Players Company is an athlete-founded organization committed to helping athletes and investors achieve their full financial potential. ca--los-angeles.description: ​ ABOUT FOUNDERS BASKETBALL ​ 🏀 Founders Basketball at 📅 NBA All-Star Weekend 2026 brings our community of startup founders and investors to Los Angeles for our biggest event yet. ​ Connect over 💼 business and 🪣 buckets during one of the most iconic weekends in sports. ​ Attendees represent companies in various stages of growth, from bootstrapped solo founders to Series B executives. We host founders from a variety of industries including CPG, Venture, Entertainment, Retail, Sports, Tech and more. ​ This special edition event features an extended format with enhanced networking opportunities, branded activations from our partners, and the chance to build authentic relationships with 50+ members of the startup community. ​ Please email brandon@neweditionconsulting.com with any questions! ​ ​WHAT TO EXPECT: ​ 🏀 Tournament-style 4v4 half-court games ​ ⏰ 2-3 hours of basketball and networking ​ ☄️ Half-court shot competition ​ ​🥇 Prizes for the winners ​ THIS EVENT IS POWERED BY: ​ ​​ New Edition ​ ​​​​​​​​ ​ A Brooklyn-based Creative Agency helping emerging eCommerce, Retail and CPG brands create winning paid and organic content. ​ ​​​​​​​​​ We serve as an extension of your in-house team, handling content deliverables and execution across video, social media, podcasts, and UGC—whatever moves the needle. ​ ​​​ We get it. Content is hard. Let us take it off your plate. Let's Chat! ​​​ ​ Law by Levin ​ We set the screens, make the assists, and hustle on D behind every founder’s win. ​ ​​​ A boutique law firm for the innovation economy, we help founders, startups, and investors scale with expert guidance in venture financing, M&A, IP, and more. ​ ​​​ Like basketball, success takes strategy and teamwork—qualities we bring to every deal.” ​ ​ SportsVisio ​ SportsVisio is an AI-powered video and stats platform that turns game footage into box scores, analytics, and shareable highlight reels. ​ Coaches, players, and leagues use it to learn, improve, and showcase performance without manual stat tracking. ​ ​ Andiem ​ Andiem helps athletes Move Better, with patented, medically-backed products to give athletes “More Days” – And + Diem. We’re focused on ankle sprains and overall foot health in basketball. ​ Later we’ll expand into other sports and applications (volleyball, pickleball, tennis etc). ca--los-angeles.title: MY SONIC VALENTINE: Love Wrapped in Sound
ca--los-angeles.description: ​ A FREE immersive Valentine’s Day offering. ​ Step into a Valentine’s Day experience unlike any other, where love, sound, art, and vibration invite connection, presence, play, and yes, more love. ​ Presented by Sonic Unity , My Sonic Valentine: Love Wrapped in Sound marks their West Coast debut, with a gathering that reimagines Valentine’s Day beyond romance, embracing self-love, friendship, and community through sound and art, and unfolds its vision across the indoor and outdoor spaces of The Wende Museum. ​ Doors open at 3:30pm and Guests will be invited to move freely, follow the sound, and experience living art and soundscapes that unfold across the museum’s spaces. This is envisioned as an interactive sound-art journey, an experience that blends stillness with mindful movement into the realm of dreamlike wandering gently through sound, art and connection. ​ In the spirit of community and public art, we are honored to welcome the NXT Art Foundation , which will present their brilliant Attune 1.0 , a first-of-its-kind public art platform designed to connect Angelenos through coordinated sound and light-based works presented simultaneously across multiple locations. Attune 1.0 , presented by NXT Art Foundation and Arup and produced by Carmen Zella (Cofounder, NXT Art Foundation and Creative Director, NOW Art), will unfold across Los Angeles County at sunset on Valentine’s Day as part of a free, family-friendly public art experience. ​ Attune 1.0 will activate the garden space as a central feature, inviting guests to bring picnic blankets or chairs and settle around a light-based installation as they experience a collective sound journey created by local artists to inspire connection and calm… ​ …and AMPLIFY LOVE . ​ At the heart of the experience is a continuous sound bath flow in the museum theater, where guests are invited to receive as much or as little sound as feels right—dipping in and out as they wish. You are welcome to lie down, sit, move quietly, or simply listen as sound moves through the space. We ask that this space be held with care and mindfulness, honoring it as a sacred environment for sound bathing. ​ THEATER | THE SOUND BATH SANCTUARY ​ A curated progression of exceptional sound artists bathing you with healing sound ​ 4:00 PM – Isaac Sabu Vibroacoustic frequencies and immersive sound healing ​ 5:00 PM – Anthony Profeta 2025 Evergreen Award Winner for Best Sound Therapist in the USA , often referred to as “The Mozart of Sound” ​ 6:00 PM – Sandy Duarte Stage 4 Cancer Survivor whose sound was born in chemo. A deeply intentional sound journey rooted in lived healing experience Supported by Peter Hess® Therapy Bowls and Rainbow Sounds® crystal bowls ​ 6:40 PM – Closing Sound Bath A powerful collective sound immersion where all artists come together to close ​ Joining us as a special guest is Grammy-nominated artist Bella Rabbit , adding her presence and creative spirit to the gathering. ​ Bella Rabbit is a Grammy-nominated songwriter, artist and producer whose voice moves between sensitivity & power, using sound as a frequency to alchemize emotion and presence. Her vocal work bridges intimacy and expansiveness, inviting listeners into a shared space of resonance and release. ​ ​ SPACES BEYOND ​ Discover Biotune Wellness Technology through vibroacoustic offerings available on a first-come, first-served basis. These experiences invite deep relaxation, heart–brain coherence, and elevated states of meditation, supporting both individual and collective wellness. ​ Fresh organic cold pressed juices to amplify your health and harmony from Eli's Elixers in the garden bar. ​ Plus, make your way up to the museum’s beautiful rooftop for Sonic Unity Talking Circles —a welcoming space for reflection, heartfelt conversation, and meaningful connection, hosted by Janein Chavez and Nick Sharp. ​ 4pm - 5:30pm ​ Janein Chavez, LMFT is a Native Angeleno, licensed psychotherapist, grief specialist, artist, globe trotter, star gazer, and radical self-care advocate. She spreads a message of self love and self compassion to her chicana/latina sisters, BIPOC women, and all people everywhere. Janein regards her life’s work as a healing artist and keeper of sacred secrets and memories, who explores and navigates the complex terrain of the heart, mind, body, spirit and soul, as if exploring any terrain on the planet…with love, admiration, respect, curiosity, reverence and awe. ​ 5:30pm - 6:30pm ​ Nick Sharp, M.A., LPCC, GEP is a nature-based therapist and guide who works with humans navigating change, transition, and personal development through relationships. His work integrates adventure therapy, equine-assisted experiences, men’s group facilitation, and off-grid sailing expeditions—across the country and internationally—to support regulation, accountability, and embodied presence. Grounded in service and lived experience, he creates structured environments where meaningful change occurs through direct engagement with inner wildness and living wilderness. ​ WHAT THIS IS ​ This is not a workshop or a traditional performance. It is a curated sonic environment designed for listening, nervous system regulation, reflection, shared presence, and most of all LOVE . ​ Open to all—come alone, with a partner, or with friends and family. Experience Valentine’s Day as a moment of self-love, friendship, community, and collective resonance. ​ ​ ABOUT SONIC UNITY ​ Sonic Unity is a collective devoted to exploring sound as a universal language for healing, connection, and collective resonance—where love is the language beyond words. Their work brings together ancient and contemporary vibrational expressions through sound, art, and technology to create immersive experiences that support nervous system regulation, emotional clarity, embodied presence, and community gathering. ​ Sonic Unity was co-founded by wellness & creative artist Sandy Duarte and wellness entrepreneur Melissa Rosen with the mission to foster coherence within the self, between individuals, and across communities through intentional sound and vibratory experiences. ​ Sandy’s sound practice was born during her journey through chemotherapy as a Stage 4 cancer patient, where sound became a source of calm, grounding, and inner peace. That lived experience informs the depth, care, and intention behind every Sonic Unity offering. ​ This Valentine’s Day gathering marks the West Coast debut of Sonic Unity’s immersive sound work , following an acclaimed multi-day event during Miami Art Week featuring over 25 sound facilitators of various genres in collaboration for continuous sound programming. ​ As founders of this movement, we leave you with both our ethos to ponder with joy and possibility. ​ “The power of love’s sound is for everyone.” – Sandy Duarte “Listening is love.” – Melissa Rosen

ca--los-angeles.title: Slab & Spread — A Galentine's Gathering
ca--los-angeles.description: ​ Remember the days of gathering with your girlfriends—catching up on life, surrounded by boundless laughter, easy snacking, and that unmistakable glow of all-around feminine energy? If you’re craving that kind of connection, join us for our very first Galentine’s Party with Cera Sera Studio x Femme Feast . ​ On Saturday, February 14th from 6–9PM , we’ll come together for a welcoming, creative evening rooted in trusting the process—in clay, in friendship, and in the simple joy of making something by hand. We’ll gather around the table to slow down, snack generously, and craft slab-built ceramic snack and serving trays designed to hold future spreads, sweet moments, and shared meals. ​ You’ll be guided through a slab-building lesson where you’ll shape, texture, and personalize your own ceramic tray. No experience needed—this workshop is all about play, imperfection, and letting things unfold naturally (because clay, like life, often gets a little messy before it gets good). ​ Throughout the evening, enjoy a thoughtfully curated communal snacking spread meant to be nibbled on as we create, connect, and celebrate the magic of gathering—whether you come solo, with a friend, or roll deep with your favorite gals. ​ ✨ Come for the clay. Stay for the snacks, the laughter, and the reminder that good things take time. Dress for a night out with the girls—styled up, dressed down, or somewhere in between. Wear whatever makes you feel most like you . ​ Your piece will be fired and glazed after the workshop and ready for pick-up in 6–8 weeks . ​ What’s Included 💝 • Guided ceramic handbuilding instruction by Cera Sera Studio (beginner-friendly, thoughtfully paced) • All clay, tools, glazing, and kiln firing — handled from start to finish 🎨 • A slab-built ceramic snack or serving tray, handmade by you • Generous grazing spread by Femme Feast 🧀 • Cheeky sips by Mas Vino Please 🥂 • Desserts by Sam Robinson Pastry 🧁 • An exclusive attendee-only raffle featuring thoughtfully curated goodies to pamper yourself long after the party ends ✨ ​ A thoughtfully curated, candlelit evening designed to romanticize the moment — celebrating friendship, self-love, and a really good vibe. Peek the inspiration vibes here ! ​ 📍 Location: Say When — 1859 W. Adams Blvd, West Adams ​ 👩🏽‍🎨 Limited spots available — reserve yours today! ​ ​​​​​ Can't make it? Join our next workshop .

ca--los-angeles.description: ​ We’re teaming up with Boichik Bagels for a relaxed morning of bagels, matcha, and pups. Bring your dog, your dog-loving friends, and come together with the community for a morning of good vibes, tasty bites, and wagging tails. ​ What to expect: 🥯 Complimentary pup cups and bagels on us — toppings available for purchase 🛍️ Something Good Treats for the pups (while supplies last!) 🌱 Fresh Patch potty station and Peony Celeste eco-poop bags 🧢 DOSC merch portion of proceeds benefiting Baldwin Park Animal Care Center ​ Come hungry, bring your dog and friends, and stay awhile to connect with fellow dog lovers. 💛 ​ 📆 Find more events at www.dogsonlysocialclub.com or @dogsonlysocialclub and subscribe to join our mailing list ! ​ ​ About Dogs Only Social Club (DOSC): DOSC is a free community group that brings pet lovers together across Los Angeles. We create un-fur-gettable experiences and meaningful connections, uniting pet parents through tail-wagging events and charitable initiatives. From dog-friendly parties at iconic LA spots to promoting animal welfare projects, DOSC helps pups and their humans make new friends while supporting local dog-friendly businesses and rescue organizations.

ca--los-angeles.title: Clay & Matcha: A Valentine’s Workshop
ca--los-angeles.description: ​ Join Cera Sera Studio and Toastique for a Valentine’s Day–inspired morning of clay, connection, and brunch at Toastique 💕 ​ This special edition workshop is all about celebrating creativity and slowing down together—because Valentine’s Day isn’t just about romance, it’s about love in all its forms. ​ 🗓 Sunday, February 15th ⏰ 10AM – 1PM 📍 Toastique | Hollywood ​ Settle in for a hands-on ceramic handbuilding workshop where you’ll learn foundational techniques—pinching, coiling, and shaping—to create your own one-of-a-kind piece. Check some inspiration here! Come with your love interest, partner, friend, your whole group chat, or solo and ready to mingle. No experience needed—just a willingness to play, connect, and get your hands in the clay. ​ As you create, enjoy a complimentary matcha or coffee , or add on a nourishing brunch from Toastique’s vibrant, specialty menu (see below)—thoughtfully crafted to fuel both body and creativity. ​ Toast options: ​ Avocado smash Smoked Salmon Greek ​ Bowl options: ​ PB&B Acai Bowl Dragon Berry ​ 🎟️ Ticket Includes: ​ Guided ceramic handbuilding workshop with Cera Sera Studio ​ All clay, tools, and materials ​ Firing and glazing of your finished piece ​ Your choice of (1) matcha or coffee ​ ✨ All ticket prices include tax and gratuity for Toastique’s staff. ​ 🌿 No experience needed—just good vibes and an open heart 👩🏽‍🎨 Limited spots available 💖 Perfect for celebrating Valentine’s Day with your favorite people (or yourself!)

Donating items or volunteering before 12:30pm grants ✨Priority Access✨ to shop! ​ ​​​ Highlights Include: 🛍️ CL Free Store – Get clothes, toiletries, household items, and more— 100% free, no questions asked . ✊ Resource Hub – Connect with more community organizations! ​ ​​​ Why Attend? ✅ Access essentials at our Free Store ✅ Meet your neighbors and local organizers ✅ Discover more resources ✅ Celebrate community resilience ​ ​​​📅 Date: Sunday, February 15th 📍 Location: Alondra Park North Parking Lot ⏰ Time: 1pm - 3pm 🎟️ Free & Open to All ​ ​​If you are looking to volunteer, visit communityloving.org/volunteer to sign up!

ca--los-angeles.location: Hustle Network, Christine Lee, Sarah Choi, Rachel Horning & 1 otherSanta Monica, California
ca--los-angeles.description: ​ Join AHN and Cooley for our Lunar New Year Celebration, a networking event uniting founders, investors, and aspiring entrepreneurs in Los Angeles to ring in the Year of the Horse. 🐎 ​ ​This event serves to celebrate the new year and provide an opportunity for founders and investors to learn about market trends, building startups, and raising money at the pre-seed and seed fundraising stages. ​ ​ *Due to limited event capacity, we are prioritizing registrations to founders, investors, and local partners. Please RSVP early to secure your entry. ​ ​📍 Location: Santa Monica, CA (exact location to be shared after registration) 🗓️ Date: Thursday, February 19, 2026 🕔 Time: 6:00–8:00 PM (PST) ​ ​ ⏰ Event Schedule 6:00–6:30: Food, drinks, and networking 6:30–7:30: Fireside chat 7:30–8:00: Food, drinks, and networking ​ ​ 🚗 Parking You can park in the office building's lot. Parking validation will be provided at the event. 🤝 Sponsored by Chingoo Snacks , Narra , Birdie , and Brandon’s Ice Cream ​ ​See you there! 🎉​ ​ Meet the Hosts ​ ​ Asian Hustle Network (AHN) ​ ​AHN is the largest global community of Asian entrepreneurs, investors, operators, and leaders, with a mission to be the global superconnector of all Asians around the world. ​ ​ Cooley LLP ​ ​Clients partner with Cooley on transformative deals, complex IP and regulatory matters, and high-stakes litigation, where innovation meets the law.  Cooley has more than 1,300 lawyers across 19 offices in the United States, Asia and Europe, and a total workforce of nearly 3,000. ​ ​Meet the Speakers ​ Stephan Peng is the Founder and CEO of Redbloom Health , the biotech company creating food medicine for chronic conditions. He created the only HSA/FSA-approved food clinically supporting IBS, GERD, dyspepsia, and colitis. Previously, Steph led product at Cheetah, Y Combinator’s largest food-tech success story, which later exited to private equity. A UC Berkeley alum and Forbes 30 Under 30 honoree, Steph now builds at the intersection of biotech, food medicine, and consumer health. ​ Jonathan Hung is a venture capitalist, operator, and entrepreneur who partners closely with founders to help turn ambitious ideas into real, scalable businesses. He is the Managing Partner of Entrepreneur Ventures , a fund co-founded with Entrepreneur Media, and also runs his family office, J Heart Ventures, with investments in 250+ companies and 50+ funds. Before investing, Jonathan led his family’s textile business across the U.S. and Asia, giving him hands-on operating experience in building teams, managing growth, and navigating cross-border challenges. He also serves as an Adjunct Professor, mentoring the next generation of builders, and holds degrees from Wharton, MIT, LSE, and USC. ​ Eric Wei is cofounder of @trykarat aka Karat Financial . Karat helps creators manage their finances and has raised over $100M, including from cofounders of Twitter, Twitch, and YouTube. Before Karat, Eric built products for creators at Instagram, did fintech at McKinsey, and investment banking at Blackstone. He studied economics at Harvard.

ca--los-angeles.title: Art Show Closing: The Balance of Elements by Liana Grigoryan
ca--los-angeles.description: ​ ​RiTA HOUSE PRESENTS: The Balance of Elements by Liana Grigoryan Thursday, February 19th from 6:30 - 9 PM ​ Join us at Rita House for a deeply personal series centered around the Five Elements: Earth, Water, Fire, Air, and Spirit. ​ Inspired by a desire to reconnect with nature's wisdom, Liana Grigoryan's work is a visual meditation on what it means to find balance within ourselves and with the world around us. This series explores how the elements reflect the cycles we all experience: creation, destruction, movement, stillness, and transcendence. ​ We invite you to experience this powerful celebration of life and connection. Light bites will be served, and drinks will be available for purchase. ​ ​ FEATURED ARTIST Liana Grigoryan ​ Liana Grigoryan is an award-winning fashion and fine art photographer based in Los Angeles. Liana’s photography captures the essence of the ever-changing world of fashion through bright colors and unexpected designs. Her work has been featured in Vogue, ELLE USA, Cosmopolitan, L’Officiel, Institute, Beverly Hills Living, Schön, and more magazines. Check out her portfolio here: https://lianagrigoryan.com/ ​ ​Rita House is a dynamic, multi-use space where people of all generations come to work, create, film, and host events including art exhibitions, immersive theatre, panels and screenings. Centrally located in a stunning 1926 Spanish Colonial building by The Grove minutes away from West Hollywood, Rita House bridges centuries of creative history with modern innovation. Originally built in 1929 as a Prop Design Studio for film and television, the building later became a violin factory producing instruments for schools nationwide. In 1967, it was purchased by award-winning costume designer Rita Riggs, who worked with legends like Alfred Hitchcock and Norman Lear. Rita established her design studio here and pioneered a unique model of creative coworking, cultivating a community of design professionals who shared her commitment to excellence and collaboration. ​ ​Today, architects and founders Tash Rahbar and Scott Strumwasser continue Rita’s legacy. After operating their architectural practice in the space for over three decades, they lovingly restored the nearly 100-year-old building and transformed it into the sanctuary for creative exploration it is today—carrying forward Rita’s spirit of innovation and community. In 2024, Rita House expanded its creative capabilities with a full-service production center, including professional content creation facilities and a podcasting studio developed in partnership with Operation Podcast.

ca--los-angeles.title: ALO RUNNERS CLUB + 1 Hotel West Hollywood
ca--los-angeles.description: ​ ALO Moves is now ALO Wellness Club , and we’re inviting you in. ​ ​Step into stride with the ALO RUNNERs CLUB and join us for a high-energy 3-mile run around West Hollywood — open to beginners, avid runners, and everyone in between. Lace up and meet us at the start line at 1 Hotel West Hollywood for an invigorating run led by Louis Chandler + ​ Stef Armstead . ​ ​All paces are welcome—whether you're a seasoned runner or just looking to move with intention. Set your pace, take a deep breath, and let the road become your moving meditation. ​ ​After the run, step into our Wellness Lounge for recovery activations — featuring Pause vitamin shots, cold plunges,  Normatech boots, and more. Refuel at the Wellness Lounge + Juice Bar and connect with the community. ​ Born and raised in London, Louis Chandler is a former professional athlete and certified personal trainer who now brings his energy and expertise to Los Angeles as the Head Trainer at Alo Wellness Club. ​ ​ Stef Armstead is a trainer at Alo Wellness Club and received his certifications from the National Academy of Sports Medicine. He is all about helping his clients achieve the goals that seem unreachable and bring out the best in them.

ca--los-angeles.title: Applied Machine Learning and AI Advancing Human Health
ca--los-angeles.location: Entrepreneurs Forum, Judith & Entrepreneurs Forum1216 E California Blvd
ca--los-angeles.description: ​ Discover how AI is revolutionizing drug discovery, biologics design, and care delivery, with innovation accelerating at unprecedented speed. AI is compressing timelines, reducing costs, improving precision, and personalizing care across the entire life sciences and healthcare value chain, from molecule to patient. For founders, scientists, and industry leaders, the focus is no longer “what’s possible?” but “what’s working in the lab, the clinic, and the market now .” This event unites leading researchers, startup founders, and industry operators advancing innovation at the intersection of computation and biology, from the Southern California ecosystem to the global stage. ​ Please note Forum events now start at 10 am. ​ ​ Keynote Speakers: ​ ​ Hosea Nelson, Ph.D. ​ Professor of Chemistry ​ California Institute of Technology ​ ​ Debbie Lin, Ph.D. ​ Life Sciences Executive and Venture Capitalist ​ ​ Speakers: ​ ​ Lucy Abgaryan, Ph.D. ​ Biotech Executive and Serial Entrepreneur ​ GrittGene Therapeutics ​ ​ Paul-Marie Cartaftan ​ AI Governance Leader & Life Sciences Advisor ​ ​ Louise Brandy ​ Chief Information Officer ​ Halozyme, Inc. ​ ​ Producers: ​ ​ Olga Batygin ​ Technical Strategy Consultant ​ ​ Pandora Ovanessian ​ CIO/CTO ​ Technology Consultant ​ California Manufacturing Technology Consulting ​ ​ Robbie Nock ​ Deputy Director ​ Caltech Center for Technology and Management Education (CTME) ​ ​ T icket Sales: ​ General Admission : $30.00 ($40.00 at door) ​ Caltech Students - No Charge with Current ID* ​ Advance Ticket Sales end on Friday, February 20th at 1:00 PM PST. ​ FORUM EVENTS NOW START AT 10 AM RATHER THAN 9 AM ​ Coffee and Networking begin at 9:00 am.
